channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Esther Perel on the Falsehoods of a Frictionless Relationship
item.description: Perel, a renowned psychotherapist, doesn’t really think society can — or should — fall in love with a machine.

item.title: Trump’s tariffs remain in the balance nearly 3 months after Supreme Court heard challenge
item.description: No one knows for sure what's going on among the nine justices, several of whom expressed skepticism about the tariffs' legality at arguments in Novemb...

item.title: How social media upended the 75-year-old playbook of big CPG
item.description: Consumers no longer look to television and mass-market media for guidance on what to buy at the supermarket.

item.title: Billionaire Mark Cuban spends hours reading 1000 emails a day on 3 devices—yet he’s telling Gen Z to shut their phones, get outside and have more fun

item.title: ‘I meant what I said in Davos’: Carney says he really is planning a Canada split with the U.S. along with 12 new trade deals
item.description: He also visibly rolled his eyes at Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s contention that he had walked back his comments at the World Economic Forum.

item.title: 50-year tradition of Southwest Airlines letting you choose your own seat comes to an end
item.description: An eight‑group boarding structure is replacing the find-your-own-seat scrum.

item.title: Five Questions for Jerome Powell, the Fed Chair
item.description: Succession drama, legal intrigue and political independence: These are top issues that DealBook would ask of the Federal Reserve chairman.
